jobsJson.descriptionPlain:
At the heart of Gojek’s businesses, we move things around. Whether that’s people, food, packages, fresh groceries, etc. Moving things around boils down to understanding the best route, understanding traffic, and understanding locations. The Cartography team is an internal team that surfaces mapping technologies needed by all internal product teams within Gojek. Examples of teams we support are GoRide, GoCar, GoFood, GoSend, GoShop, and GoPay.

Our work is highly impactful and higly visible, which we believe leads to strong job satisfaction for our team members. When you take a ride home from work with Gojek, you can see your newly released features enhancing the pickup, dropoff and ride experience for yourself … and millions of others across Southeast Asia. These features include highly accurate pickup and dropoff locations, better routes to be taken, ETA times and so on, all engineered to perform fast and seamlessly at the scale of hundreds of thousands of requests per second.

jobsJson.additionalPlain:
Gojek is a technology startup based in Jakarta, Indonesia. Specialising in ride-hailing and logistics, we are also the only company in Southeast Asia to be part of Fortune's 50 Companies That Changed the World (2017).

Gojek is a Super App: one app with over 20 services including food delivery, commuting, digital payments, shopping, hyper-local delivery, massages, and many more.

Gojek is Indonesia’s first and fastest growing unicorn building an on-demand empire. Our total of 2,000,000 driver-partners collectively travel 16.5 million KM daily – making us Indonesia’s de-facto transportation choice.

Gojek is a verb! Gojek is a way of life!

lists.content:
• You will own technical projects from designing to planning to implementation to deployment
  • You will collaborate closely with the Cartography data science team to turn their models into useful and highly scalable services, with ops teams to develop features that help manual curation and fine-tuning of location data, and with a variety of product and app teams across the business
  • This is a small but growing team so you will have an unmatched impact on the trajectory of this team

• 3+ years of experience in software development or a serious open source track record
  • Experience in designing, developing, testing and deploying large scale applications in any language or stack, ideally REST + JSON APIs
  • Higher education qualification in Computer Science / Engineering or related discipline is beneficial
  • Basic knowledge of different databases (SQL / NoSQL) and their tradeoffs. We primarily use Redis, PostgreSQL + PostGIS, and ElasticSearch; familiarity with any is a plus
  • Proficiency in OOP, including design patterns. Experience with functional programming is a plus
  • A generalist who can work on backend systems or frontend code
  • Knowledge of Unit Testing, Integration Testing, Load / Stress Testing, and Test-Driven Development
  • Experience with routing and mapping a strong plus
  • We primarily use Golang, Clojure, JavaScript, and Node.js. Familiarity with one or more is a plus
  • DevOps/systems/networking experience a plus
  • Maintain a balance between building sustainable, high-impact projects and shipping things quickly
  • Instill a spirit of continuous improvement in the team’s code, architecture, and processes
  • Strong communication, empathy, and patience, but with a go-getter attitude that consistently works with other teams and offices to get projects delivered in a large interdependent company
